ygData.subject: RE: Re: Songs and Resists
ygData.msgSnippet: the damage part is true, but it only applies to damage to hp as far as I know, I believe all other debuffs are the same vs. player as vs. npc. Kit ... From:
ygData.messageBody:
the damage part is true, but it only applies to damage to hp as far as I
know, I believe all other debuffs are the same vs. player as vs. npc.

Kit

-----Original Message-----
From: Robin Wise 3 [mailto:eurmali@...]
Sent: Thursday, December 09, 1999 12:38 PM
To: eqbards@onelist.com
Subject: [eqbards] Re: Songs and Resists


From: "Robin Wise 3" <eurmali@...>

>
>Message: 24
> Date: Wed, 8 Dec 1999 11:54:25 -0500 (EST)
> From: <kim@...>
>Subject: Re: Songs and resists
>
>On Tue, 7 Dec 1999, Talies the Wanderer wrote:
> >
> > Crission's Pixie Strike:
> > A lot of you have noticed that you get resist after resist with Pixie
>Strike, until it "takes" - then it suddenly works over and over (ditto with

>Charm?) Weeeeeelll - apparently, an "undocumented feature" of those two
>songs is a slight magic resistance debuff.
>
>I noticed no change to my MR when I used Pixie Strike on
myself. Will have to test it again.

I noticed this a few days ago while messing around in HK basement. At level

32, wind skill 165, Pixie Strike lowered my magic resist by 6. It's not a
lot, but it could certainly account for the ease with which the song is
maintained once a target is stricken. Fufil's lowers MR by 10 at the same
level... so (just a thought) in some cases where you're in a caster-heavy
group it might make sense to weave Pixie Strike and Fufil's to lower the
target's magic resist by quite a bit.

On this note, I have heard rumors that the damage done to players (and to
one's self) is only a fraction of the damage done to monsters (2/3 being the

number I have heard most often). Can anyone confirm or deny this rumor? If

it is true, then Fufil's and Pixie Strike combined will lower MR by 25 (10
from PS, 15 from Fufil's)... which is rather a lot, I think.

Aloro Silvertongue (E'ci)

with the subject submissions.
